attributes.action: Overseas military action to require super majority vote of two third of MP’s
attributes.background: The Petition's purpose is to ensure a higher percentage of the electorate’s views are taken account of when Parliament considers military action and that only Parliament can authorize the deployment of UK military forces as non-combative advisers in overseas conflicts to which the UK is not party.
attributes.additional_details:
A Parliamentary Motion for armed conflict is perhaps the most significant matter that our MPs’ are ever required to vote upon and as in the case of Iraq and subsequent conflicts their vote has had enormous repercussions for the United Kingdom, not only in terms of  those killed and wounded but in the aftermath, as now seen in Iraq, Afghanistan and Libya.

The present majority government received less than 37% of the vote from just 24% of the electorate at the 2015 General Election.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require men to wear a neck tie at work
attributes.background: It's still legal in the UK for a company to require male members of staff to wear neck ties at work against their will. Dress code laws should be changed so that men have the option to wear neck ties at work, if they wish. Current formal work dress codes are out-dated and sexist.

attributes.action: Regulate and reduce hospital car parking charges.
attributes.background: My son was admitted to Gloucester Royal and on every visit we had no choice but to use their car parks.  On one occasion we parked at 15.08 and left at 16.10 and were charged 2 hours and there was no allowance for any "time" to get your ticket and vacate the car park.

attributes.action: Make letter boxes for homeless people or people without an address.
attributes.background: In the UK we have a fantastic welfare system. Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: Recognise Care Assistants as an actual career and better pay more than N.M.W.
attributes.background: Care Assistants should be recognised as an actual career path and should be paid better than the National Minimum Wage or 2016 renamed (National Living Wage) and be able to progress up the ladder with educational help available.
attributes.additional_details: People who go into the Vulnerable Adult Sector I.e. Care Assistants work 12 hour shifts sometimes do not even get time to have proper breaks because they are so busy get just the basic national minimum wage regardless of the new name and in some cases just don't even have the option to progress up the ladder this should be changed the minimum age should be changed to 21 to work as a Care Assistant and they should also feel valued Minimum Wage 12 Hour shifts does not make you feel valued.

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with £155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of £119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over £40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: Restrict who can buy UK land and property to uk residents only
attributes.background: It is very concerning that persons who live in other countries and are not resident here are allowed to purchase housing stock, further pushing up prices for uk residents when there are limited resources.

attributes.action: Provide Prostheses rather than wigs for patients with total hair loss.
attributes.background: For seven years we have been asking our health provider to supply a human hair prosthesis that fits can be washed and styled.  Our GP and consultant are fully supportive but at the point of supply the bureaucrats say NO.
attributes.additional_details: Our dealings with the NHS medical professionals has been exemplary understanding  the emotional and mental strain caused by total hair loss particularly in a woman. However all requests for a proper prosthesis are denied for reasons that are unfathomable.  Example cost ( our proposal costs less ). Not NHS approved, (some trust supply). And of course the you need individual funding committee approval ( they always say NO that's their job, all requests made by doctors and consultants are ignored.

attributes.action: UK should double its Gold because other central banks are buying up all the gold
attributes.background: Gold is money and has been for thousands of years. The money we use today is the faith backed fiat system.People have started to loose faith in the dollar and all other fiat currencies like the Euro.The only way forward is a gold backed currency.
attributes.additional_details:
Interesting websites regarding gold as money

HTTPS://www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Http://kingworldnews.com
Http://www.dailyreckoning.co.uk

attributes.action: Use all car tax money's to repair roads and pot holes as suggested
attributes.background: I would love to drive on a smooth road with out hitting pot holes that no one seems to repair. We are forced to pay road tax and it seems the money we put in don't get used towards what it is mean for. I would also like to see cyclists pay road tax after all they use our roads
attributes.additional_details: The evidence is on every road in the UK. Holes in the roads are becoming  more and more frequent and this needs to be dealt with

attributes.action: Legalise the importation, sale and consumption of coca tea in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Coca tea is a safe, healthy and natural herbal tea that would be beneficial to UK consumers.

The 2016 United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Drugs (UNGASS2016), to be held on the 19th-21st April, offers the unique opportunity to open up debate on the issue.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please visit the following:

Transnational Institute - Coca leaf: Myths and Reality

http://www.druglawreform.info/en/issues/unscheduling-the-coca-leaf/item/262-coca-leaf-myths-and-reality

APPG for Drug Policy Reform - Coca leaf: A political Dilemma?

https://www.unodc.org/documents/ungass2016//Contributions/Civil/APPG_for_Drug_Policy_Reform/Coca_Report_final_25_Sept.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.action: Scrap Air Passenger Duty (APD) on all UK flights
attributes.background:
Air Passenger Duty (APD) is the UK Government tax that is currently being charged on all passengers departing from a UK airport. Which since introduction in 1994, has risen by up to 539%.

Abolishing APD would see a significant increase in the UK’s GDP as well as the creation thousands of jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK ranks 137th out of 138 when it comes to air ticket taxes and charges - 2015 World Economic Forum’s Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report.

Only six EU countries levy a similar tax, but with substantially lower rates than those in the UK.

The high charges of APD are severely hindering economic growth in the UK's Transport and Leisure Industry. In order to boost economic growth and improve competitiveness in the market, I urge the UK government to scrap APD.

attributes.action: Make the AA49 (wolverhampton) 70mph again.
attributes.background: The A449 has scrapped the national speed limit and has been replaced by a 50/60 mph speed limits. I see this as a pure waste of money and a great way to sting motorists with speed fines. I believe that it should be made a 70mph again.

attributes.action: Reduce number of Constituencies by 20% to achieve savings in Goverment spending.
attributes.background: The chancellor has confirmed that additional cuts are required in his recent Budget. As this must be shared equally, parliament itself must cut costs. Elected MPs should represent larger numbers and areas and be excluded from  having additional employments which may affect their elected obligations.

attributes.action: DVLA to review their policies of exemption circumstances for medical conditions
attributes.background: DVLA legislations states that people who are monocular are exempt from exceptional circumstances in their medical section.
attributes.additional_details: I was born with one eye and head neck and facial disfigurement I had driven for 30 years I was legal to drive until DVLA changed their policies in 2013. The condition is congenital and is a non degenerative condition. Therefore the only change is DVLA policies. The machine (esterman vision test) that DVLA use to assess people's vision for driving was not designed to assess people's ability to drive it was to detect glaucoma. Due to my disfigurement the machine isn't fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Reject proposals to increase Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: The Chancellor may use the budget to increase insurance premium tax (IPT) as he did last year. This may seem an obscure tax but it will heavily  impact those paying the highest premiums already - the young and those who live in high risk areas - often the people least able to afford any increase.
attributes.additional_details: In the last budget the Chancellor increased IPT from 6% to 9.5%. Rumours are taht he may increase it a further 3% which would put £37 on the average car insurance premium. It would also increase home, pet and medical insurance as well as car breakdown cover. It is a pernicious tax because, while it affects everyone, it disproportionately affects the young and those who live in high risk areas who are least likely to be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Block Recep Tayyip Erdogan from coming to UK
attributes.background: His double standards on terrorism (by allowing the wounded terrorists in his country), deporting of Kurds (who are 100% against ISIS) and setting the ME very unstable are his violations of International Law. He must not be allowed to speak in UK!

attributes.action: Make Parking free for doctors in NHS.
attributes.background: At present every doctor has to pay £1.50 per day parking minimum to park their vehicle to come to work. Monthly £45/- to park in place of work in hospital which should be free.
attributes.additional_details: The argument by government is that more people should travel by public transport but the argument against it is that the doctors have to work odd hours of day and night so they need to travel by personal transport if they have one which is not only more convenient then public transport at odd hours especially but also saves time if public transport is not available near to their destinations also the travel by public transport increases the expense exponentially.

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum drinking age of low ABV alcoholic beverages to 16.
attributes.background: The minimum age for all alcoholic beverages is currently 18. This should be lowered to 16 for drinks that contain less than 10% alcohol by volume, in order to teach youths to drink responsibly. This is successful in Germany, where it is legal to purchase low alcohol containing beverages at 16.

attributes.action: Cut F35 orders for RN and replace them with a capable air superiority fighter
attributes.background: The F35 is not capable of being an Air Superiority fighter and would put Royal Navy pilots at a high risk of loss in air combat situations against super sonic soviet era jets with modern avionics packages.The Royal Navy needs carrier based fighters capable of defeating Sukhoi and Mikoyan (mig) Jets.
attributes.additional_details: The F35 is not capable of dog fighting and is not suitable for providing a close air superiority role. It has been beaten by the F16 jet in close air combat situations and dog fights, this aircraft has been built since the 1970's. This shows just how bad of a multi-role jet it is. It is to expensive for what it is and would save the government and tax payers millions by canceling a large amount of orders.These canceld orders should be replaced by the better Dassault Rafale M or F18 Super Hornet

attributes.action: Make prenuptial agreements legally binding
attributes.background: Prenuptial agreements are not legally binding in the UK, making divorce a financial burden, rather than an emotional burden.

attributes.action: Change school admissions for SEN or disabled children.
attributes.background: Because parents find it increasingly difficult to choose a school under another authority even if that school is closer to the child's home. There is not enough done to support patents especially if non of the schools in the child's current LA are suitable or not where you wish your child to go.
attributes.additional_details: My own experience I am having a severely hard time at the minute trying to get my SEN child who should be attending a special needs school in September we are constantly been pushed away from our chosen school from our current LA because it's in the next LA even though the school is more suited to our daughter she loved it there on an open day and it is 1.3 mile away from home. No one from the LA is willing to help despite it being our request of school it's wrong and it needs to be adjusted

attributes.action: Close the Westminster Parliament if Britain votes yes in the EU referendum.
attributes.background: As the European Union would be making all the decisions regarding Britain a national parliament is an expensive entity no longer required.

attributes.action: Pass an Act of Parliament guaranteeing the asylum of Julian Assange.
attributes.background: Julian Assagne has had to seek refugee in the Ecuadorian embassy in London. Now that the UN has said that Assange has been declared to be in arbitrary detention. I call on the UK government and MP's to pass an Act of Parliament to protect him from deportation and thus grant him asylum in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce Road Safety Cameras that reward safe driving while discouraging unsafe
attributes.background: Problem is speeding traffic. The Road Safety Camera would do two things. It would capture speeders and issue penalties in the usual way but with an amount of the fine going into a fund pot; then if you are obeying the speed you are entered into a draw to win some of that fine money from the speeders
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thefuntheory.com/speed-camera-lottery-0
http://gamificationofwork.com/2011/10/the-speed-camera-lottery/
http://thegovlab.org/wiki/Stockholm_Speed_Camera_Lottery_(The_Fun_Theory)

attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: Fit breathelisers on every car manufactured so the engine won't start if present
attributes.background: I am a coach driver for national express and every time I want the engine to start I have to do a breath test, should ANY amount of alcohol be found the engine won't start. This will reduce drink driving. We should have a zero tolerance against drink driving.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling by businesses to mobile and home phones
attributes.background: Cold calling has always been a problem but recently it is becoming a real nusense with companies ringing personal mobile/home phones at all times of day and night sometimes multiple times within a day to either sell products, force PPI claims or tell you you've been in an accident when you haven't.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies should not be able to obtain and call your personal phone often with wrong or assumptive information and of a repetitive nature, with some companies calling multiple times in the same week despite being told you are not interested which is harassment and against human rights.

I am petitioning to ban cold calling from businesses to home and mobile phones as to protect people from being harassed in their personal time as it can be very distressing in particular for vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile

attributes.action: Increase government funding for youth clubs across the UK.
attributes.background: Many people have little awareness about the issues that face young people. Youth clubs support ANYONE in issues they face and help them tackle them but also enjoy themselves. However, there is little awareness, funding or volunteers to help support them so we want the government to increase funding.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of youth clubs go unnoticed, they help thousands of young people get out and meet new people. They relieve built up stress and help with issues that can affect mental health. By raising the funds it allows more young people to be involved in society and make a positive impact towards the community.

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Stop NHS healthcare surcharge as part of Non-EU immigration application.
attributes.background: Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
The amount of the surcharge is as follows:
£200 per year for all migrants except:
Tier 4 students who will pay £150 per year

attributes.action: Jail for 30 days if you leave pets/children unnattended in cars on a hot day.
attributes.background: The amount of people leaving their pets in hot cars on a summers day is insane. People know the dangers but dont seem to care. I propose a minimum jail term of 30 days for people who commit this act against animals or children.
attributes.additional_details: evidence is everywhere

attributes.action: Change burden of proof of dangerous dog to be responsibility of the accuser.
attributes.background: Many innocent dogs have been seized from their owners and euthanised, and it is the responsibility of the respective owners to prove that their dog is not a banned type. This is a perversion of the burden of proof and needs to be changed so that the authorities must prove that the dog is banned.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, a dog is determined to be dangerous by the authorities based on the dog's appearance, rather than by hard evidence or by what the dog has done. It is currently the responsibility of the owner of the dog to prove the claim that the dog is dangerous to be false. If the owner cannot prove this negative, the dog is then euthanised. 

"Whether your dog is a banned type depends on what it looks like, rather than its breed or name." Source: https://www.gov.uk/control-dog-public/banned-dogs

attributes.action: Ban people working when temperature goes over 30C or 27C in a physical job
attributes.background:
Bring in a law were employers have to send home employees when temperature goes over 30C or 27C when working in a physical job

There is no guideline on being sent home if the work place gets too hot, working in a too hot enviroment can cause dehydration and risk of fainting

attributes.action: Use Dog DNA to solve dog pooh problems
attributes.background: Dogs create around 1000 tons of pooh per day in the UK. Current initiatives are not effective in forcing owners to pick up their dogs pooh. As dogs now have to be microchipped, I propose that their DNA is included in the information on the microchip. This in turn can be used to trace the owners.

attributes.action: Stop all Police cuts within the UK and increase high visibility patrols.
attributes.background: We need more police officers on the streets not police cuts

attributes.action: Make the title nutritionist protected
attributes.background: there are many people out there that call them selfs a Nutritionist  however quite a few of them do not hold any degree that gives them the right to be called one let alone to work as one, some people tend to do a few day course which  this will allow them to give nutrition advice out to people
attributes.additional_details:
due to these few days  courses  which people do this causes a knock on effect on our jobs as a nutritionist also this puts people health at risk due to the advice that gets given is incorrect on a few accounts. 

make our title protected like the dietetics is protected

attributes.action: I want Parliament to fund the RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances
attributes.background: The RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances are a vital part of our emergency services and should not solely rely on charity funding to operate, they should be funded just as the Police, Fire and ambulance services are funded

attributes.action: Condemn dismissal of judges by Turkish authorities following military coup
attributes.background: Turkish authorities have reacted to the military coup by dismissing nearly 3000 judges around the country. This is a clear victimisation of members of the legal profession and is a disproportionate measure which will impact on administration of justice.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit of the motorway to unlimited
attributes.background: In Germany I realized how efficient and well maintained the highways were and how advanced the "Autobahns" are similar to the "smart" motorways we have in the UK. I believe we should have a system in place where in certain areas of the motorway it should have an unrestricted speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: 6% of deaths occur on British motorways and 40% in urban roads. a further 54% of deaths occur on rural roads. compared with Germany their motorway deaths stand at 12%, 60% on rural roads and 28% in urban areas. I believe we should use the same system where we can adjust the speed limit to the road conditions using the smart motorways (such as limiting the motorway to 70mph in wet conditions etc) and introducing unlimited speed limits in quiet times such as 9pm-8am. This would allow less accidents down rural roads as there is a safer place to speed (as shown by statistics)

attributes.action: Train operators should provide more rolling stock to give all commuters a seat
attributes.background: Train operators habitually operate trains with 4 carriages at peak times causing dangerous levels of overcrowding. Many at non-peak times have up to 12 nearly empty carriages.  They justify this to get rolling stock into position. If they were to invest in enough stock this wouldn't be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: This is self evident to thousands of commuters who use the trains everyday and put up with poor customer service. Part of the franchise should enforce investment in rolling stock to fully meet peak demand.

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: Allow non resident UK Citizens to also vote on whether the UK Leaves the EU
attributes.background: British people living abroad were NOT allowed a vote and are hugely impacted by the outcome. We form a constituency of people who live a special way of life in the EU - the life that experiences free movement of labour and we well understand free trade benefits. An important voice could not vote.
attributes.additional_details:
I am British, I live in Germany. I have a UK pension, I am likely expected to pay inheritance tax upon death and who knows where I might retire. This decision affects people like me too and we need to have a vote on this matter.
The UK parliament should debate if we are now allowed also a vote which should be integrated retrospectively with the referendum already held, and see how this impacts the referendum result.
